Same reason the stars twinkle. There is different and disturbed air in between and it's bending the light. As for what's causing the disturbance, it caused by the different heat of the surfaces. Ever see an image bendy and distorted on a particularly hot day over concrete or asphalt? That's because the man made surfaces are absorbing and releasing alot of heat. So the air above is disturbed. It's visible even in daylight because of the extreme heat, but when it's dark and far away you can get the same effect even when it's not so hot.

Anarchism doesn't mean no rules, just no leaders. Socialism means control of the means of production are own by the society as a whole and not an individual person. This is one of the more fascinating things I learned about recently. They think in sign language. [If they are deprived of the opportunity to learn sign language, they start to suffer from cognitive disabilities.](http://www.hearingreview.com/2016/02/study-revisits-sign-language-affects-cognitive-development-deaf-children/) Simply put, we need that voice in our head to organize our thoughts. Deaf people don't have a voice in their head, they have signing hands in their heads. [When a person who is born deaf become schizophrenic, instead of auditory hallucinations, they see disembodied hands signing to them.](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/news-articles/0707/07070303)

Johor is in another country. Singapore is technically a parliamentary democracy, but the same party has won every election since the beginning. The strategy seems to be to have the ideology be fluid, get all the smart ones into the ruling party, leaving only the idiots for the opposition. It's difficult to measure causes and effects, but the Cabinet seems to have far fewer lawyers and more engineers and economists. Is it because or does it result from the relative lack of need to campaign? I'm not sure.

It's more designed to avert an economic catastrophe, which comes from large portions of a population being unable to afford anything due to their unemployability. It's also an efficient replacement for the entire social safety net. You can go ahead and abolish HUD, Medicaid, Social Security, the minimum wage, the ACA, and many other government support programs without compromising standards of living. All of those were ways to give the poor money in order to live, just filtered through a bunch of bureaucratic hoops. So a more frugal version might be implementable now with the current incentive structures remaining in place.

I'm stealing this idea from another redditor, but... If your house gets struck by lightning and catches fire, you don't say "Oh that was caused by nature, so I'm doing nothing" then watch your house burn down. No, you put out the fire and install a lightning conductor so it doesn't happen again. So even if this warming is 100% all natural, it's still going to kill us all, so humanity should be working to reverse it.

WRITING.TEXT:
There are many ways a nuclear explosion can kill you, there's alot of overlap, but they tend to vary depending on how close you are or what type device was used. Close in, the nuclear explosion creates a fire ball, it's hotter than the surface of the sun. Burned to death really doesn't cover it, cremated still isn't enough, it's hot enough to turn your entire body to carbon from the heat and leave nothing but a dark layer of soot on the wall. Further out the light from the blast is still strong enough to cook. Imagine putting your hand in a toaster, increase the strength of that until it can set things on fire.
As all this burning is going on, the air is expanding rapidly because of all the heat. This results in a wall of wind going out at about the speed of sound.
Close enough and this wind is like getting hit by a truck, and you get pulped. Further out and your lungs get damaged and you die.
This wall of wind doesn't just pulp you, it damages building, weaker buildings collapse and you die from stuff falling on your head.
Now lets step far away from the explosion and discuss one of the most incorrectly ridiculed bits of cold war civil defense education. You're standing in a home when you see a sudden flash of light. Most human's primitive ape brain are wired to go look for the new bright shiny thing. So you get up and go to the window to look for the bright shiny thing. Remember that blast wave I told you about earlier? That's travelling slower than light. It takes a few seconds to reach you, you took a few seconds to get to the window. The blastwave is pretty far out, but it's got enough force to break a glass window. You die from hundreds of glass daggers to the face. And this is why you Duck and Cover.
